basics.name: Stefan Riedel
basics.label: Research and Software Engineer in Audio/Music Technology
basics.summary: Researcher, developer and music producer specialised in the emerging field of 3D Audio/Ambisonics. I have experience in system design and music production for hemispherical loudspeaker arrays, compact spherical loudspeaker arrays and Binaural 3D Audio.

work.company: German Aerospace Center (DLR), Institute for Robotics and Mechatronics
work.summary: Research and software engineering work on various topics, projects and platforms:
highlights: software modules for mobile manipulators (robotic platforms: AIMM, LRU)
data collection for machine learning (robotic platforms: AIMM, C-Runner, David)
contributions to six conference and journal papers
machine learning for robot dynamics (shallow, deep, incremental; Scikit, Tensorflow, PyTorch)

work.company: RoboCup Logistics League-Team 2011, 2012, 2014, Technical University Munich
work.summary: Co-founder and core developer within a small student team (3-7 people) participating at RoboCup Logistics League:
highlights: overall system and control architecture (with core team members)
LSPB trajectory generation using quadratic splines
PD trajectory control and shared-memory actuator communication

work.summary: Total of 23 months at TUM, JHU (USA) and DLR on various topics:
highlights: 2014, DLR, Master-Thesis Research: point-cloud perception, feature-based object pose estimation, recursive probabilistic orientation estimation, next-best-view planning

2013, CIRL, JHU (USA): point-cloud-based sequential scene parsing with physical constraints (ROS, C++, PCL, Bullet Physics), integration of perception into a human-robot collaborative system (Python, VTK)
2011, DLR, Bachelor-Thesis: numerics of Kalman filtering (UD-factorization), automated noise covariance optimization
2010, TUM: hardware/software co-design for an Altera FPGA by means of an automated code generation approach using Matlab's Simulink
